reg_pit.acttitle: Local Government Bylaw Notice Enforcement Act
reg_pit.title: Bylaw Notice Enforcement Regulation

change.changenote: Section 1 (2) was added by BC Reg 7/2010, effective February 1, 2010.
Section 1 (2) (a.1), (c.1), (c.2), (c.3), (g) and (h) were added by BC Reg 72/2011, effective May 1, 2011.
Section 1 (1) definition of "certificate" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 224/2017, effective December 6, 2017.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: certificate means a certificate in the form prescribed in section 14 of this regulation filed with the Provincial Court under section 26 [amounts owing enforced as Provincial Court judgment] of the Act;

change.changenote: Section 1 (2) (a) and (a.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 157/2019, effective July 10, 2019.
Section 1 (2) (a.2) was added by BC Reg 157/2019, effective July 10, 2019.
Section 1 (2) (c.01) and (c.02) were added by BC Reg 91/2023, effective April 3, 2023.
Section 7 (5) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 75/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an adjudicator resigns or his or her appointment expires other than by a rescission under subsection (3) and the adjudicator has started to hear a dispute, the adjudicator may continue to act as an adjudicator until the adjudicator has decided the dispute and provided his or her decision to the local government under section 14 [adjudicator decision] and section 10 [adjudicator's remuneration and expenses] applies.

change.changenote: Section 10 (5) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 75/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In addition to the amounts under subsections (1), (2), (3) and (4), if an adjudicator must travel more than 32 kilometres from his or her usual place of employment for a hearing in person, an adjudicator must be paid

change.changenote: Section 14 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 75/2022, effective March 30, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An adjudicator who hears a dispute in respect of a bylaw notice or the rescission of a compliance agreement must provide his or her written decision to the local government that issued the bylaw notice,

change.changenote: Schedule 1, District of Tofino added by BC Reg 230/2009, effective September 24, 2009.
